sub_title: Head of Administrative and Personnel Division at the International Court of Justice (ICJ)
summary:
Currently, Head of Administrative and Personnel Division at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) in The Hague.	
Previously, Chief Human Resources Officer for the United Nations Regional Office for Central Africa.
Over sixteen (16) years’ experience in Management, with focus on Strategic and Operational Human Resources Management, including over 11 years international experience with the United Nations. 
Working experience in multicultural environments, and away from home country.
Competent in People Management, Office administration, Supervision, Leadership, Communication, Problem solving and analytical thinking. 
Expert in Talent Management, Organizational design and workforce planning, Recruitment and selection, Performance Management, Learning and Development, Career development, and other areas of Management.
Master's degree in Management from the University of Greenwich, London, UK.
Able to prioritize effectively, multitask and achieve results within time and budget.
Known for building strong relationships with internal and external partners.
A flexible team member who loves to learn from each bit of experience.
Experience with different ERPs such as SAP and People soft, and different other IT-related tools and applications.
Fluent in both English and French.

profile_positions.description:
- Represents the Organization with full delegation of authority in discussions with Senior Leadership on recruitment and other human resources matters; and Manages recruitment process including development of recruitment strategies and plans.
- Advises the Senior Leadership on the development, modification and implementation of United Nations policies and practices on entitlements.
- Contributes to the budget development process by reviewing the drafts and providing input on the human resources requirements and organizational structure of all sections.
- Advises the mission in the implementation of the performance appraisal system and monitors its compliance with the proper implementation of the performance management system, providing guidance and substantive support to mission components on standards for the development of service, section, unit and individual work plans.
- Counsels staff and managers in cases of underperformance and facilitates the implementation of a Performance Improvement Plan (PIP) or other remedial measures, when required.
- Continuously assesses the skill, expertise and knowledge of staff, ensuring participation in relevant training programmes and designing individual on-the-job and group training programmes on specific subject matters.
- Provides inputs to efforts and measures aimed at addressing and mitigating staff grievances with the purpose of resolving them at the lowest practical level.
Contributes to the development of preventive activities such as training and sharing best practices and recent jurisprudence related to human resources management.
- Supports dialogue between the management and international and national staff unions (Field Staff Union and National Staff Committee respectively to discuss HR matters and related staff issues;
profile_positions.title: Chief Human Resources Officer

profile_positions.description:
As a strategic partner with the organization’s leadership, it was Happy's role to advance the overall mandate of UNDP Rwanda through planning, aligning, attracting, deploying, developing & retaining a competent, diverse & dedicated workforce within a supportive work environment. 

She achieved results by delivering work services in the following functions: Human Resources Planning; Job analysis; Recruitment and staffing; Learning and development; Performance management; Administration of benefits and entitlements; Pre-payroll administration and process; Maintenance of personnel records; Human Resource direction and technical assistance and Development and interpretation of HR policies and procedures.

In all her decisions, She was guided by the UNDP values of: Integrity; Transparency; Mutual respect; Professionalism; Accountability; and Results orientation.

To deliver, She balanced the following: Quality, Cost and Schedule.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Analyst & Learning Manager

profile_positions.description: Worked with the team of the Office of Human Resources on one of the most complex restructuring processes that the organization has ever gone through.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Analyst (on detail assignment)

profile_positions.description:
While maintaining her contractual relationship with UNDP Rwanda, Happy was in UNDP South Sudan for three months to manage the Country office's Human Resources Realignment process (Restructuring) whereby she managed recruitment for the new positions and agreed separations for displaced staff whose positions were abolished or not matched with those in the new structure.

Key achievements:

•	Advised the senior management of the country office on the change process in terms of managing recruitment and selection processes. The emphasis was on documenting and reporting on each stage of the process; achieving the right balance between giving internal candidates due consideration and chance of remaining on board, and attracting the best talents from outside labor market; and making sure that the whole process leads to the achievement of the CO’s strategic goals.
•	Successfully managed recruitments for over 33 positions in just three months, spanning job announcements; screening of applications and administration of written and oral interviews; and submission of the recommended cases to the Compliance Review Panel and extending offers to the selected candidates. 
•	Provided career guidance to staff members of the country office in weekly sessions to guide staff members on career planning, job search, CV writing, preparing for technical written tests and competency-based interviews.
•	Led the HR team of professionals in the Country office following the resignation of the HR unit, advising the management on a number of specific HR issues in addition to Change Management related work.
•	Guided HR colleagues and shared relevant knowledge with them on HR administration and leave management.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Analyst (on detail Assignment)
